intro: Commelina kabarensis, commonly known as the Kabare commelina, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes a variety of grass-like and herbaceous plants. The plant features slender, upright stems and produces small, blue or violet flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elongated and have a smooth or slightly textured surface. Commelina kabarensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
